WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic:
Although this kanji has two on'yomi to learn, the pronunciations of those two on'yomi are very similar, so that should make them easier to remember.
When you were nine your favorite foods were cookies (ã) and cucumbers (ãã‚…ã†). Yum yum!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture nine-year-old you, lining up nine cookies and nine cucumbers. You dip a cookie in milk and bite into it, then dip a cucumber in and take a bite. Nine bites each until they're all gone. Ah, you miss being nine.

origin_of_ch_char_book: (è¬, ä¸‡, wan, ten thousand) is the shape of scorpion . The tail of this character shows a hook with three swords (trident): (ä¹, jiu, nine). In ancient times, people often ate large numbers of scorpions that they cooked, skewered on a stick. Now it means the number 10,000. This could be also due to scorpionâ€™s characteristics of living in groups and laying many eggs.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle " nine " and " elbow " have the same shape, and the inscriptions of Shang and Zhou Dynasties and the Warring States period are the same as those of Oracle. " Nine " means elbow. It is the first text of " elbow " (Ding Shan, Ming Yishi, Li Xiaoding). Later, the word " inch " was added under the word, see " elbow ". " Nine " was later borrowed as a number. "Shuowen": "Nine, the change of the Yang. It is like the shape of its buckling. All the belongings of the nine are from the nine."

Oracle is used as the original meaning, "Compilation" 13677 is: "Ji Jiu (elbow)", referring to elbow disease.

In addition, the Jia Jin inscription indicates the number and ordinal number, "Compilation" 358: "ğ¤‰²(ç‡) nine cows", refers to the sacrifice of nine cows. "Collection" 8108: "September, only (in) Gun." Zhefang Yi: "Yu (only) Wang Shi and (you) nine sacrifices." " Sai " is the year, here refers to the 19th year of Zhou Wang.

Bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are also used as numerals, "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 5: "Kuang Tianxia Zheng (politics) ten and (have) nine years and Wang Tianxia."

The silk book of Mawangdui has the word "Jiuzhou", which is handed down in the document "Book. "Yugong": "Yu does not belong to Kyushu." According to Kyushu, it means Jizhou, Yanzhou, Qingzhou, Xuzhou, Yangzhou, Jingzhou, Yuzhou, Liangzhou, and Yongzhou. In addition, Mawangdui silk book also has the term "Nine Heavens", "Chu Ci. "Li Sao": "It refers to the nine days of being righteous." Wang Yi's note: "Nine days, that is, the central government."

" Nine " in the ancient seal means " dove ", "Ancient Seal Compilation" 1551: "Sun Jiu (dove) Yi (Yi)." Wu Zhenwu and Xu Zaiguo both pronounced "Jiuyi", "Lu Shi" named it as " After the Song Gong clan."

In addition to being used as a numeral, " nine " in handed down documents can also refer to the majority in general, "Guang Ya. Interpretation IV": "Nine, research also." Wang Zhong, "Shu Xue. Interpretation of the Three Nineths": "Therefore, the wording of the stranger, if one or two can not be done, then the three can be seen as many; if the three can not be done, the nine can be seen as many, this language The imaginary number is also." Liu Shipei, "Ancient Book Supplement Examples. Examples of Imaginary Numbers Not Really Referable": "The precept of "nine" is "research," and it is also an extreme number. Any number that refers to its extreme must be called nine, and it does not have to be grounded in real numbers.
humanum_short_description_en: The shape of the " nine " of the Oracle bone inscription is like the shape of an arm, and it is the first text of " elbow ". After lent as a number.

It is the first text of " elbow" (Ding Shan, Ming Yishi, Li Xiaoding). Later, the word " inch" was added under the word, see " elbow". " Nine" was later borrowed as a number. "Shuowen": "Nine, the change of the Yang. It is like the shape of its buckling. All the belongings of the nine are from the nine." Oracle is used as the original meaning, "Compilation" 13677 is: "Ji Jiu (elbow)", referring to elbow disease. In addition, the Jia Jin inscription indicates the number and ordinal number, "Compilation" 358: "ğ¤‰²(ç‡) nine cows", refers to the sacrifice of nine cows. "Collection" 8108: "September, only (in) Gun." Zhefang Yi: "Yu (only) Wang Shi and (you) nine sacrifices." " Sai" is the year, here refers to the 19th year of Zhou Wang. Bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are also used as numerals, "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 5: "Kuang Tianxia Zheng (politics) ten and (have) nine years and Wang Tianxia." The silk book of Mawangdui has the word "Jiuzhou", which is handed down in the document "Book. "Yugong": "Yu does not belong to Kyushu." According to Kyushu, it means Jizhou, Yanzhou, Qingzhou, Xuzhou, Yangzhou, Jingzhou, Yuzhou, Liangzhou, and Yongzhou. In addition, Mawangdui silk book also has the term "Nine Heavens", "Chu Ci. "Li Sao": "It refers to the nine days of being righteous." Wang Yi's note: "Nine days, that is, the central government." " Nine" in the ancient seal means " dove", "Ancient Seal Compilation" 1551: "Sun Jiu (dove) Yi (Yi)." Wu Zhenwu and Xu Zaiguo both pronounced "Jiuyi", "Lu Shi" named it as " After the Song Gong clan." In addition to being used as a numeral, " nine" in handed down documents can also refer to the majority in general, "Guang Ya. Interpretation IV": "Nine, research also." Wang Zhong, "Shu Xue. Interpretation of the Three Nineths": "Therefore, the wording of the stranger, if one or two can not be done, then the three can be seen as many; if the three can not be done, the nine can be seen as many, this language The imaginary number is also." Liu Shipei, "Ancient Book Supplement Examples. Examples of Imaginary Numbers Not Really Referable": "The precept of "nine" is "research," and it is also an extreme number. Meaning Mnemonic
Nice! This kanji is the same as the radical that looks just like it (down to the meaning, even!). The radical is nine and the kanji is nine, making the meaning of this kanji really easy to remember as long as you know the radical first.
If you know your radicals well, this kanji will be a breeze!
Reading Mnemonic
Although this kanji has two on'yomi to learn, the pronunciations of those two on'yomi are very similar, so that should make them easier to remember.
When you were nine your favorite foods were cookies (ã) and cucumbers (ãã‚…ã†). Yum yum!
Picture nine-year-old you, lining up nine cookies and nine cucumbers. You dip a cookie in milk and bite into it, then dip a cucumber in and take a bite. Nine bites each until they're all gone. Ah, you miss being nine.
